# Conclusion {-}

If someone locks their doors to their neighbors, should they be commended for their prudence or ridiculed for their suspicion? A normative prescription for how much security people should consume is unclear; the “right” amount of security consumption can vary both within and across individuals and circumstances (e.g., a rich vs. poor person purchasing security, or weighing the “ultimate price” of dying).
